questions.question: A block of mass $m_1$ rests on an incline of angle $\theta = 20^\circ$. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction are $\mu_s = 0.8$ and $\mu_k = 0.5$. It is connected via a massless string over a massless and frictionless pulley. Block $m_2$ has mass $2\ \text{kg}$. If $m_1 = 1.5\text{kg}$, what's the magnitude of the acceleration of the $m_2$ (in m/s$^2$)?

solution.description: From the handwritten notes: $F_2 = m_2 g = 19.62$. $F_1 = m_1 g \sin\theta = 5.032$.

solution.section_title: Compare forces and friction direction (from notes)
solution.description: From the handwritten notes: $F_2 > F_1$. 'The friction force acts against $F_2$.'
From the handwritten notes: $\sum F = ma = F_{net}$.
Boxed expression in the handwritten notes: $$a = \dfrac{-m_1 g \cos\theta \mu_k - m_1 g \sin\theta + m_2 g}{m_1 + m_2}.$$
From the handwritten notes: $m_1 =$ mass Block 1; $m_2 =$ mass Block 2; $\mu_k =$ kinetic friction coefficient; $g =$ gravity.
